posts.title: ICYMI: Become a Fan of NWA Daily
posts.content:
Hey friends, we wanted to share a little update about NWA Daily! We've come a long way since we began in early 2021, from just an idea to over 23,000 subscribers. We've had a blast curating content and keeping you up-to-date and connected in NWA, and we are so thankful for all of you!

  • In the beginning: A little bit about us. We're just two couples that love NWA and want others to know and love it like we do! We have been running NWA Daily on the side and bootstrapping it with our own resources since the very beginning.
  • What's next: In an effort to continue to provide you with the best and most relevant content in a fun and efficient way, we're expanding our team, aiming to bring on a new full-time hire in the next few months! In conjunction with this, we're launching a reader revenue program where you can become a 'Fan' of NWA Daily through voluntary financial contributions to help us achieve goals like hiring new full-time team members!

In addition to helping us bring you better content, becoming a fan will also give you access to exclusive giveaways from our local partners. If you've enjoyed following along and have learned something new about NWA from us, we hope that you consider supporting us HERE.

posts.title: NWA Food Bank Takes A Stand Against Hunger
posts.topic: Sponsored by Hark at Excellerate Foundation
posts.content:
The Northwest Arkansas Food Bank is making a difference in the fight against hunger. In 2021, they distributed over 14m lbs of food and currently have over 110 partner agencies across Benton, Carroll, Madison, and Washington counties.

  • The rent eats first: Housing affordability directly impacts food insecurity. NWA Food Bank and organizations like Hark at Excellerate Foundation are exploring ways to help our community grow strategically, so we don't leave our most vulnerable neighbors hungry.
  • Good work: Many volunteer opportunities are available at the Food Bank, such as serving in the warehouse, volunteering at a mobile food pantry, or working in the Food Bank's garden.

Learn more about the NWA Food Bank HERE.

posts.title: Northwest Arkansas Ranked 4th Best Places To Buy A Home In 2023
posts.content:
The Northwest Arkansas metro area was ranked the 4th best place to buy a home in 2023 by the National Association of Realtors.

  • Rapid growth: The population of Northwest Arkansas is growing at an annual rate of 2% compared to the national average of just .01%.
  • Better prices: The region ranked 2nd on the list regarding housing affordability with a median home price of $328,400 compared to the 2022 national median of $379,100.

Watch the KNWA news story HERE.

posts.title: Hugo's Of Fayetteville Nominated For Arkansas Food Hall Of Fame
posts.content:
Fayetteville's vibiest burger joint has been nominated for the 2023 class of the Arkansas Food Hall of Fame.

  • Basement burger: Located in the basement at 25 1/2 N Block Ave, Hugo's has been serving up a delicious menu since 1977, but their specialty is a top-class burger paired with homemade fries.
  • Best in state: Arkansas Heritage began the Arkansas Food Hall of Fame in 2016 to honor the great food traditions of Arkansas and the people who make them. Hugo's was the only restaurant nominated out of Northwest Arkansas this year.

See a complete list of finalists in About You HERE.

posts.title: Get Ready for Loma's Grand Opening Tomorrow
posts.content:
It's time - Loma, launched by one of the owners of Tula in Fayetteville, officially opens tomorrow! We had a chance to get a sneak peek and dine at the restaurant last week, and we just couldn't wait to tell you about it.

  • A feast for the eyes: The stunning 9,000 sqft restaurant was designed by a Mexico City architecture firm and gives off the perfect warm and cozy vibes. And, when NWA isn't blanketed in snow or ice, there is an enormous rooftop patio to enjoy. Located in the ONE Uptown building, the location is prime and is another A+ addition to the Pinnacle Hills area.
  • A taste of Mexico: In addition to some of the classics we've come to know and love at Tula like the Guacamole and the Cochinita Pibil, we also tried some delicious plates exclusive to Loma. The Pork Belly Carnitas and and Chicharron De Ribeye were fantastic, savory starters. We finished the meal with Ahi Tuna which was incredibly fresh and flavorful and the Barbacoa, which was fall-off-the-bone tender and packed with flavor.

Go ahead and start making your reservations and see for yourself why the NWA Daily crew is already planning our return.

pick.title: NWA Daily Picks
pick.content:
• Perfect pair: Smokin' Oak Wood-fired Pizza & Taproom in Fayetteville specializes in artisan-quality, wood-fired pizzas and has a unique digital taproom wall where you can find the perfect beer to go along with it.*
  • Stocked shelves, full hearts: Mr. Kim's store is full of heart, humor, and hope. The only thing missing from Kim's Convenience is you! Get tickets today for TheatreSquared's hit comedy on stage now.*
  • Slimdale: Springdale is due for another Slim Chickens, planned to open soon at 401 S Thompson St.
  • By design: The Architect's Newspaper recognized multiple faculty members from the U of A's Fay Jones School of Architecture in its 2022 AN Best of Design Awards.
  • Packing on pounds: Tyson Foods took a stand against food insecurity in 2022, donating over 18m lbs of protein to food banks, relief organizations, and community kitchens around the nation.
  • Let's talk: Interested in advertising in the newsletter? Check out our deals HERE.

*Content is sponsored
